sentences.en: A few disruptive students can easily ruin a class.
sentences.cn: 只要有几个爱捣乱的学生,就能把全班搅乱.

sentences.en: Absences at school began to drop and the children's disruptive behaviors softened.
sentences.cn: 上课缺勤率开始下降,孩子们的捣乱行为有所缓和.

sentences.en: Alcohol can produce violent, disruptive behavior.
sentences.cn: 酒精会引发暴力和破坏性行为。

sentences.en: But Rolex thrived in the face of disruptive technologies.
sentences.cn: 但劳力士在面临破坏性技术的蓬勃发展.

sentences.en: But these shifts are at the very least disruptive.
sentences.cn: 但这些转移也有一点儿破坏性.

sentences.en: Change will indeed be painful for incumbents, as disruptive innovation always is.
sentences.cn: 对于在职者来说“变化”和“颠覆性质的创新”一样一直以来确实都是令人痛苦的.

sentences.en: Disruptive innovations, however, usually translate into cheaper products with lower profit margins.
sentences.cn: 而颠覆性创新通常会转化为利润率较低的便宜的产品.

sentences.en: Effects of the struggle will be violent and disruptive.
sentences.cn: 斗争的结果将会是暴力的、破坏性的.

sentences.en: He has a disruptive influence on the other children.
sentences.cn: 他能影响别的孩子使他们失控.

sentences.en: He was expelled from school for disruptive behaviour.
sentences.cn: 他因破坏行为被学校开除了.

sentences.en: Mike’s parents thought I was a disruptive influence (= a person who causes disruption ) .
sentences.cn: 迈克的父母认为我是个捣蛋分子。

sentences.en: Rapid and disruptive change is now happening across new and old businesses.
sentences.cn: 时下,无论新旧产业都在发生着超乎想象的飞速变化.

sentences.en: She had a disruptive influence on the rest of the class.
sentences.cn: 她搅扰了班上其他的学生。

sentences.en: She was a disruptive influence, and after a year or two she got the boot.
sentences.cn: 她总是影响正常的工作，一两年后便被解雇了。

sentences.en: Short selling is disruptive speculation that requires someone else to lose.
sentences.cn: 买空卖空是破坏性很大的投机勾当,总要导致损人利己的结果.

sentences.en: The process of implementing these changes can be very disruptive to a small company.
sentences.cn: 对于小公司来说，实行这些变革可能会带来灭顶之灾。

words.tran_cn: 破坏；使瓦解；使分裂；使中断；使陷于混乱
破坏的；分裂性的；制造混乱的

trans.tran_en: causing problems and preventing something from continuing in its usual way
